headline: Garrett Motion (GTX) Valuation In Focus After JPMorgan Overweight Call And Zero Emission Expansion
summary: Recent analyst coverage of Garrett Motion (GTX), including a new Overweight initiation from JPMorgan, has refocused attention on the stock as investors weigh the internal combustion engine business alongside the growing zero emission vehicle push. See our latest analysis for Garrett Motion. At a share price of $18.48, Garrett Motion has seen a 10.13% 1 month share price return and a 44.94% 3 month share price return. headline: Bank stocks to buy after earnings
summary: The fourth quarter was a big one for all of the major banks. Crossmark Global Investments chief market strategist Victoria Fernandez shares which of the big banks stocks investors consider now while Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Ines Ferré takes a closer look at the results from Morgan Stanley (MS) and Goldman Sachs (GS). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Bank execs optimistic on the economy. Everyone else is worried.
summary: As earnings releases continue to roll out from Big Banks this week, S&P Global Market Intelligence director of financial institutions research Nathan Stovall reacts to the commentary from banking executives on the economy and the state of the US consumer. Also watch Nathan Stovall comment on why bank stocks may be slipping despite generally positive earnings results. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: As Trump's deadline for a cap on credit card rates looms, banks have only questions and no answers
summary: President Donald Trump a week ago told the credit card industry it had until Jan. 20 to comply with his demand for a 10% cap on interest rates.  With just days to go, consumer groups, politicians, and bankers alike remain unclear on what the White House has planned and whether Trump even remains serious about the idea.  White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt said the president has “an expectation” that credit card companies will accede to his demand that they cap interest rates on credit cards at 10%.

content.title: As Trump's deadline for a cap on credit card rates looms, banks have only questions and no answers

White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt said the president has “an expectation” that credit card companies will accede to his demand that they cap interest rates on credit cards at 10%.

headline: Trump Loads Up On $51 Million In Bonds As Markets Brace For Jerome Powell Showdown
summary: President Donald Trump has aggressively expanded his personal bond portfolio, purchasing at least $51 million in debt securities between mid-November and late December, according to a White House financial disclosure released Thursday. The disclosure comes as JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE:JPM) CEO Jamie Dimon warns that the administration’s escalating legal war against Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell risks destabilizing the very markets the President is buying into. A Persistent Buying Spree A
